Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Hyicin 4244 (XXC; natural AMPs; sactipeptide; 3S=CA; XXJ; UCSB1c;  bacteriocin, Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes)

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis reveals that the unmodified sequence of this peptide shows 72.2% similarity toSubtilosin A1. Thus, it is predicted to have similar S-Calpha bonds between C4-F29, C7-T28, and C13-F22.Activity: Active against S. aureus 4124 and S. saprophyticus 46s,
Literature Information.Author: Duarte AFS, Ceotto-Vigoder H, Barrias ES, Souto-Padr√≥n TCBS, Nes IF, Bastos MDCF.2017
Literature Information.Reference: Int J Antimicrob Agents. 2018 Mar;51(3):349-356. doi: 10.1016/j.ijantimicag.2017.06.025.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Hyicin 4244, the first sactibiotic described in staphylococci, exhibits an anti- staphylococcal biofilm activity.
